name: fermion

a type of subatomic particle (= an extremely small piece of matter that is smaller than an atom, or found inside an atom): Despite being endlessly varied, matter actually contains only two kinds of building blocks: bosons and fermions. Electrons, protons, and quarks are all fermions.
More examplesFewer examplesFor a long time, cosmologists had expected the plasma to be a gas of weakly interacting fermions.A fermion can be thought of as containing a tiny bar magnet.In the 1970s, scientists divided particles into two families, bosons and fermions, according to their spin pattern.
